name: MD2WP
description: A build task that can be used to publish markdown files (in Git) to WordPress.
author: Moonspace Labs, LLC
helpMarkDown: A build task that can be used to publish markdown files (in Git) to WordPress.

inputs.name: wpUrl
inputs.label: WordPress URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: The URL for the destination WordPress site.

inputs.name: wpUserName
inputs.label: Admin Account
inputs.helpMarkDown: The user name used to sign in to WordPress. **NOTE**: This user must be in the Administrator role.

inputs.name: wpPassword
inputs.label: Admin Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: The password used to sign in to WordPress. It is recommended that you use a secret variable to provide this value.

inputs.name: wpPublishAsDraft
inputs.label: Publish New Posts as Draft
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, new posts will be published as a Draft and you will need to modify the corresponding entry in the Mapping File to make the post public; Otherwise, if unchecked, new posts will be made public immediately.

inputs.name: wpPublishAsCommitter
inputs.label: Publish as Commit Author
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, the post will be published using the WordPress account that matches the e-mail address of the markdown file committer. The associated WordPress user must have 'author' rights. Otherwise, the posts will be published using the WordPress credentials provided to this build task.

inputs.name: wpUseFolderNameAsCategory
inputs.label: Categorize by Folder Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, the folder name containing the markdown file will also be associated as a Category with the post.

inputs.name: wpUseFolderNameAsTag
inputs.label: Tag with Folder Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, the folder name containing the markdown file will also be associated as a Tag with the post.

inputs.name: wpTrackPostIdInFilename
inputs.label: Track ID in Filename
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, the post ID will be added to the end of the markdown filename. This will allow the file to be properly tracked if it is moved and/or renamed. Checking this option is recommended.

inputs.name: vstsToken
inputs.label: VSTS Access Token
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Personal Access Token used to access the VSTS project containing the markdown files to be published. It is recommended that you use a secret variable to provide this value.

inputs.name: vstsMetadataFile
inputs.label: Mapping File
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the mapping file (e.g. _md2wp.json) used to track information related to each published markdown file. If the file does not exist, it will be created the first time the task is run.

inputs.name: vstsProcessSubfolders
inputs.label: Process Subfolders
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, all subfolders will be processed; Otherwise, only the folder containing the Mapping File will be processed.

inputs.name: addEditLink
inputs.label: Add Edit Link
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, an 'Edit this page' link will be added to the bottom of the published document.

inputs.name: editLinkText
inputs.label: Edit Link Text
inputs.helpMarkDown: This is the text that will be displayed as a link to the source (markdown) file in VSTS.

inputs.name: editLinkStyle
inputs.label: Edit Link Style
inputs.defaultValue: background-color: #2E5481; color: #FFFFFF; padding: 5px 10px; text-decoration: none; border-radius: 5px; font-size: 8pt;
inputs.helpMarkDown: This is the CSS style that will be applied to the Edit Link Text.

inputs.name: embedExternalImages
inputs.label: Embed External Images
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked, external images (images source from outside VSTS/TFS) will be embedded as Base64-encoded data; Otherwise, external images will simply be linked to.
